story:
Short Summary

Holly Pratz and Natalie Rieboldt are teachers/ colleagues/ administrators/ friends who wish to broaden their knowledge and research in the field of early childhood education by traveling to Reggio Emilia, Italy where the Reggio Emilia approach to education was born after World War II. Over the past 30 years, the system in Reggio Emilia has become one of the most acclaimed in the world by evolving into a distinctive and innovative set of philosophical assumptions, curriculum and pedagogy, method of school organization, and design as a whole. The city of Reggio Emilia operates and finances 22 pre-primary schools for children ages 3-6 and 13 infant/ toddler centers for children ages 0-3. 

Natalie has been the Director and Lead Preschool Teacher at the Silverton Family Learning Center (SFLC) for 5 years. In her time at SFLC, her leadership has strengthened SFLC's programs by infusing the center with a strong curriculum and made it a place where all children have their needs met. They are able learn to their highest potentials while developing habits of life ling learners. 

Holly has been teaching Kindergarten and First Grade at the Silverton Public School of Expeditionary Learning for 7 years and has served as President of the Board of Directors for SFLC since 2009. Working together has ensured that Silverton youngest learners enter Kindergarten prepared for success. Families and teachers establish a nurturing and positive relationship early on because of the collaboration between Holly and Natalie and their schools. 

Natalie, Holly, SFLC's Board, and the Public School Board all see this professional development opportunity as an important step to further and strengthen the education available to Silverton's youngest learners and families.

What We Need

This opportunity is not cheap, yet comparing it to other high quality professional development sessions, it is comparable, and well worth it when we consider the high level of learning, research, discussions, site visits, lectures, and networking that we will be exposed to. 

Program Fee (7 days of lectures, site visits, discussion/research groups, accommodations, meals)

$2,790

2 people

$5,580

Airfare (Durango, CO to Milan, Italy)

1,500

2

3,000

Food

350

2

700

TOTAL

$9,280
Projected Funding Sources:

SFLC

$2,000

Silverton School

3,500*

YOU - Indiegogo Campaign

Total: $9,000

3,500

*upon the School Board's approval


The Impact

The primary impact is the way that this experience will change and enhance the education that children ages 0- 7 receive in Silverton. Upon returning, we will be able to implement what was learned into the curriculum and pedagogy of the early childhood education programs. We will share what we have learned with our community and schools from nearby communities as SFLC is the only Reggio Emilia inspired school in the 4 Corners area. As educators, we are devoted to a life of learning. Researching educational systems around the world will give us the opportunity to lead school reform initiatives and innovations to education. Meeting and networking with other teachers who share similar philosophies will help us continue to grow as educators long after this trip ends.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share what we are doing with anyone you know and in any way you can!

story:
Dankind Academy is a humanitarian program in East Africa using basketball as a vehicle for progress. Our goal is to train, mentor and educate athletes to become charitable, professional basketball players who are also role models and responsible for uplifting and constructing in their communities in order to benefit the next generation. 

The Academy is in search of a €35,000.00 sponsorship in order to continue providing 16 aspiring athletic and tall African athletes with a daily elite basketball training program in Nairobi, Kenya. This will be the second Dankind Academy season after a very successful first year when the boys lived in a house together, trained every week and were crowned Nairobi Basketball Association Champions.


The sponsorship money is used to provide the following :

- 2 daily 3 hour training sessions 6 days a week.
- 3 weekly weight training sessions.
- 2 - 3 league and friendly games per week
(with highlights posted online)
- 3 meals a day, everyday.
- Accommodation (rent, electricity, water)
- Cleaner and cook
- Experienced and strict coaching staff.
- Video analysis sessions.
- Swimming on days off
- Transportation to and from games
- Referees during mid week friendly games
- League costs and affiliation

The goal of the academy is to train players to become professional basketball players in leagues all around the world as well as role models dedicating 10 percent of their salaries in the future to not only keep the academy running but also to provide the following benefits for the next generation in their own developing nations:

- Building perpetually energised homes
- Investing in solar panels
- Building schools, hospitals, water pumps, libraries and basketball courts
- Establishing coaching and referee clinics
- Establishing, promoting & funding leagues
- Coaching at summer basketball camps
- Motivational public speaking

Follow us online :

http://www.dankindacademy.com
https://www.facebook.com/DankindAcademy
http://www.youtube.com/user/dankindacademy
https://twitter.com/DankindAcademy

e-mail : dankindacademy@gmail.com
tel : +254 704835101

story:
The "Galloping Ghost of the Java Coast," the USS HOUSTON CA-30 was once the flagship of the Asiatic Fleet, and US President Franklin D. Roosevelt's personal favorite. On February 29, 1942 the Houston was sunk by the Japanese navy. Of the crew of 1,061 men, 368 survived the battle, only to be captured by the Japanese and interned in prison camps.

Mission

The USS HOUSTON CA-30 Dive Team Mission is to promote and continue the incredible history of the crew and ship (once considered the Flagship of the Asiatic Fleet and FDR's favorite). The story of the USS HOUSTON has been overlooked and we are determined to honor both the ship and crew through our continued efforts to preserve her forgotten history. Videotaping shows how nature is taking the ship back to the sea. The team seeks to preserve information about the ship for educational purposes for generations to come. 

Recent salvage operations have us very concerned. Photographic evidence helps the US Navy and Australian Navy as they work with the Indonesian government to curtail grave site salvage operations.

The team seeks only to video / document what remains for survivors and families to view. Many of our members have loved ones who went down with the ship. The donated ROV is the same company that entered the USS ARIZONA. They are not amateurs, and fully understand the respect to be given this wreckage. The team leader is the son of a survivor and has been on dives of the HOUSTON in past years. He has shown great reverence for this ship and her wreckage.

Learn More

Please visit our homepage to learn more about the USS Houston CA-30, the brave men who served and died aboard; the Dive Team, and the Survivors Association.

Thank you for your support!! -- Jay Hannah, grandson of Earl C. Humphrey, survivor of the USS Houston and 3.5 years as a POW on the Burma-Thai Death Railway ("The Bridge on The River Kwai")

Dive dates: July 22 - Aug 5 2014. Dive location:

Perks

Ship Coin

USS HOUSTON CA-30 commemorative coin. Beautiful, heavy (3 oz) heirloom.

T-Shirt Graphic (front)

Lapel Pin

Custom Memory Tile (4"x4")

Custom Memory Tiles (6"x6")

Where Does the Money Go?

story:
Why Me?

Hello! Thanks for stopping by my campaign. My name is Sophie and I am a junior Environmental Design major studying at the Maryland Institute College of Art. If you have kids, or know someone who does, then you know college is expensive! I am very lucky to be able to go to such an amazing art school in Baltimore Maryland. However at this point the college funds (aka the rents) are pretty tapped out. So I must turn to the Internet! I have a great opportunity to study abroad in Peru for three weeks this summer but it is rather on the pricey side. I chose to crowd source for this chance because I think there are a lot of other students like me who are scared to step out and ask for help. We all have personal goals and things we would like to do, and without one another we cannot accomplish those goals. Personally, I have always wanted to see Machu Picchu in person. As a design student I cannot think of a more powerful example of lasting and genius design than the terraces that the Inca built over 500 years ago. If my campaign is funded not only will I be able to go to Machu Picchu but I will be able to travel all over southern Peru and have invaluable experiences. Please take a minute to check out my perks and support me if you can!

I am relying mostly on my photography skills for these perks, to check out my photography works and my other design/ artwork please go to my website http://cargocollective.com/sophiestoerkel

story:
Who we are, what we do

Bible Raps is a Jewish education initiative that mixes hip hop and Torah to turn young Jews and gentiles onto the Bible as seen through the Rabbi's eyes. We teach Torah through hip hop songs and put curriculum in the hands of Jewish educators for them to do the same. Kid tested, Rabbi approved! After five years of touring around the world workshopping with Jewish youth and collecting loads of accolades, Bible Raps is now gearing up to put out is big album of over thirty Bible Raps. We need your help! 

Don't Trust us, Trust your ears! Click Here To Listen To Full Album

What your donation Makes Possible

  • Studio time
  • Mixing/Mastering, Replication
  • One year Paid Intern: Booking Agent
  • One year Paid Intern: Social Media
  • One year Paid Intern: Community Organizer
  • Animation music videos for classrooms

If we exceed our goal we will hire a full time development position so Matt can spend his time doing what he does best -  perform, teach, and create with his team.

Perks

  • With these albums, we will be bringing Jewish education to your community. We'd also like to give you a little somethin-somethin for your support ~ 

Help Make Noise about the Bible Raps Campaign! 

  • Share on Facebook 
  • Tell your Rabbi, Jewish Organization, Jewish Camp, Day school . . . .
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
In recent decades, our world has experienced a disconnect in understanding basic work principles and where our food comes from, and in appreciating the land and the environment that surrounds us.

What can you do to help?  

The Lighthouse Montessori Farm School Project is an educational opportunity geared toward teaching our community and families agricultural awareness. The Lighthouse School's goal is to build a Farm School that provides activities and learning opportunities that are now absent from most children's lives and which will include:

  •  outdoor exploration
  • agricultural science
  • domestic sciences
  • environmental sciences
  • entrepreneurial skills

Lighthouse Montessori Farm School will have a variety of opportunities for outdoor exploration and learning.

The history of our project starts with a young mother, Laurie, who was experiencing increasing concern with her children's education. Teachers and principals offered little help.  Determined to give her children the best education she could, she discovered and researched the Montessori Method.  This method centers on the ideal that education should be an aid for the children's future life, helping children to be independent and to love learning.  

With a three-month baby in tow, Laurie studied and trained, receiving her Montessori certification. She has now been teaching for over 30 years and is a leading expert on the Montessori Method.  In 2003 she opened a Montessori school in her own home in Idaho and in 2005 Laurie founded Lighthouse Montessori School. Laurie also established a Montessori Teacher Training Center, where she has prepared and instructed many future Montessori teachers.   Still firmly dedicated to the principles of family and education that motivated her as a young mother, Laurie's vision is to create the Lighthouse Montessori Farm School that will be an ideal learning environment for children and will also be a place for families and the community to experience the joy of both working and celebrating the land.  

Aerial photo of the future Montessori Farm School, with fruit and evergreen trees, pasture land, a school building, and out buildings.  Located just east of Idaho Falls.

The ideal property is available on the outskirts of Idaho Falls on 40 acres of predominantly wooded land and already includes a working farm, equipment barns, and a residential house that is perfect for converting into a school.  The School will serve preschool through 8th grade and will provide a challenging academic curriculum while also incorporating agricultural activities.  

A peaceful environment where children will feel safe to explore.

This campaign is to raise $150,000 required to make the initial investment to acquire the property, and to make minor adjustments, which include safety and size modifications to the school house, irrigation installations to the land, and construction of animal shelters.  Any funds received will be used toward a down-payment on the property and making initial changes, even if our specific goal is not reached.

Existing structures include a farmhouse to be used as a School building (pictured above), caretaker's cottage, equipment barn, feed shed, and chicken coop.

Lighthouse Montessori Farm School will give families and students the opportunity to learn and experience a farm-based community and be immersed in agricultural and nature lessons in a warm, family-friendly environment.  Farm life and nature will be abundant throughout the grounds, providing for hands-on exploration and learning in an outdoor/indoor environment. 

Community families will be welcome to visit the farm, learn about the farming process, and participate in activities of animal care and agriculture.  It is the first farm school of its kind in Idaho to fully implement Dr. Montessori's "Education for Life" model. Learning and work will emphasize experience in:

  • leadership training
  • zoology
  • botany 
  • greenhouse for winter activities
  • animal husbandry 
  • agricultural science 
  • ecology
  • biology 
  • economics 
  • food science 
  • land management 
  • domestic sciences 
  • environmental sciences 
  • entrepreneurial skills

Apple and pear fruit orchard, well maintained and chemical-free.

Our goal is to help prepare students for life — to extend their work to the wider community and to the land.  Laurie and Lighthouse Montessori School need your help to make it happen.  We invite you to donate now and support us in creating an agricultural learning resource center. Together we are working to build a sustainable model of education, create a warm and loving home-like environment, and engage in the full cycle and seasons of farm life.

The property is ideal for livestock entrepreneurial activities for students.

Quite simply, we need your donations.  Please click the tab at the top, right and generously help us at a level appropriate for you. Share the link on social media using the share buttons on this webpage.

Donate by clicking on the button at the top, right.
Visit our website at www.lighthousemontessori.org
Like us on Facebook at www.facebook.com/lighthousems

story:
These are the facts: 


We have a problem, but changes in policy can save lives. 

Federal law requires licensed gun dealers to conduct background checks when selling guns. Most states do not require background checks for firearms purchased at gun shows - this is called the "gun show loophole." This allows criminals and the mentally unstable to easily purchase guns. 


Let's do something. 

9 out of 10 Americans support universal background checks. 
This should be a political slam dunk, but the NRA and weapon manufactures continue to oppose these policy changes. They've erected billboards and donated millions of dollars to politicians. Politicians are listening and supporting dangerous gun ownership policies. 
Now you know the facts. It's time we fight back.  

Let's raise a billboard in West Texas sharing facts about gun violence. We can change public opinion, change laws and save lives.


Join Us: Donate Now! 

Every 5 minutes an American is a victim of gun violence. Let's do something about it. In order to raise a billboard for 6 months, we'll need $15,000. 

If we don't hit $15,000, we'll send postcards sharing facts ($0.89 each, including artwork) to homes in west Texas. We'll send as many as we can afford with what we've raised.

story_txt:
These are the facts: 


We have a problem, but changes in policy can save lives. 
Federal law requires licensed gun dealers to conduct background checks when selling guns. Most states do not require background checks for firearms purchased at gun shows - this is called the "gun show loophole." This allows criminals and the mentally unstable to easily purchase guns. 


Let's do something. 
9 out of 10 Americans support universal background checks. This should be a political slam dunk, but the NRA and weapon manufactures continue to oppose these policy changes. They've erected billboards and donated millions of dollars to politicians. Politicians are listening and supporting dangerous gun ownership policies. 
Now you know the facts. It's time we fight back.  Let's raise a billboard in West Texas sharing facts about gun violence. We can change public opinion, change laws and save lives.
Join Us: Donate Now! 
Every 5 minutes an American is a victim of gun violence. Let's do something about it. In order to raise a billboard for 6 months, we'll need $15,000. 

If we don't hit $15,000, we'll send postcards sharing facts ($0.89 each, including artwork) to homes in west Texas. We'll send as many as we can afford with what we've raised.

story:
Short Summary

The Professional Performing Arts High School Vocal Program,  in Partnership with National Chorale, engages students daily, throughout the school year, in a rigorous vocal music curriculum including musicianship, music theory, individual and group vocal instruction and developing a high quality performance oriented Choir.  Students perform outside of the school in various performance activities as well as in school performances.

What We Need & What You Get

This year, in addition to solo performances, the Concert Choir will be performing at its annual Holiday Concert, the entire  "Gloria" by Antonio Vivaldi.  Our students will be presenting this Holiday performance at St. Malachy's Actors Chapel in Manhattan on December 10, 2014, at 7pm.  We would like to engage a Chamber Orchestra to accompany our Choir of 100 voices.  Your contribution will enable our students to engage in a professional performance setting working with seasoned professional musicians.

The Impact

Students will have the opportunity to rehearse and perform with professional musicians, further developing their own musicianship and performance skills.  Our audience members will have the thrill of enjoying this great work of music with the orchestration intended for its performance, while being impressed with the hard work of our students and Artist Teachers.

Risks & Challenges

We hope to have a successful campaign and engage these your artists with this professional music setting in which they can enjoy the rewards of performing with seasoned musicians and to continue to develop and enhance their own performance skills.

story:
See the Freedom to Ferguson story here:

Click here to view the above storydeck presentation with powerful statements by MLK, LBJ and BHO. You'll be shocked by the statements from LBJ's 1964 State of the Union address that pertain to Ferguson today!

I'm the author of a new ebook, "From Freedom to Ferguson: The Private Sector Opportunity to Empower Black America." 

I'm also a co-founder of ScaleUp Partners, LLC, a nationally networked, regionally focused consultancy dedicated to inculcating inclusive economic competitiveness strategies in economically disconnected communities. We are the nation's leading voice of Inclusive Competitiveness.

I'm raising immediate funds to conduct Phases 1 and 2 of a multi-phase economic transformation project in Ferguson, Missouri. I will get to work as soon as the minimum funds are raised.

You will take this journey with me and experience it vicariously through my day-to-day engagements. I will become your eyes and ears on the ground in Ferguson as I conduct the business of developing a local coalition of collaborative leadership focused on establishing an economic initial integration platform.

The outcries of the community in the wake of the shooting death of unarmed black male teenager by local police, have gained national attention. Since the grand jury decision to set aside all charges, Ferguson has attracted numerous community leaders, celebrities, clergy and media to the region. My effort in Ferguson is distinct from all others.

I intend to initiate a process of sustained "Inclusive Competitiveness" that will serve as a model for other similarly situated communities to follow across the nation.

The funds raised will cover initial engagement and travel costs for one week. I will maintain a daily blog, plus offer access to a Google Hangout for those who join my Ferguson Strategic Advisory Committee.

The goal of this trip is to identify targeted local leadership and develop the foundation for an ongoing effort of connecting the economically disconnected population of Ferguson to local resources. Once a coalition of the willing is established, I will work with the group to produce a viable Economic Action Plan that will ultimately lead to economic transformation of the community, including job growth, wealth creation and increased economic competitiveness overall for the region.

Your support of this mission means you will have an insider's seat on the journey to witness each day's challenges and successes.

story:
Short Summary

On Saturday, April 25, 2015, the Himalayan nation suffered a massive 7.8 magnitude earthquake. Receiving outside help has become a matter of life or death.

The setting is gut-wrenching. Inconceivable devastation, children dying of deadly diseases, whole villages reduced to rubble.

As the days go by, death tolls tick up. With already more than 4,000 people dead, the country’s worst earthquake in almost a century has severely damaged Nepal’s already fragile infrastructure and displaced many from their homes without basic necessities.

The Impact

With fears growing for the fate of people in these remote villages, A group of volunteers of all around the world have come together with CAS to reduce the aftershock and support with long-lasting relief efforts.
Our priority is to assist the education system by creating schools. Not only will we ensure children the opportunity to grow in a safe environment but will help the economy with jobs.

There is an urgency to the needed; and knowing well how devastation can spread its roots beyond the immediate crisis we must reaffirm the capacity to generate major changes in their environment. Help us secure their future. 

Lets reduce the aftershock

You can help too.

For more information or questions, please contact  or2nepal@gmail.com


Other ways to help Nepal

Any amount you can contribute will be helpful, but even if you can’t donate, you can help us spread the word by sharing this site on Facebook, Twitter and emailing your family and friends.  The more people who know about this effort, the better chance we have of helping people in need in Kathmandu, Nepal. 

 There are a lot of relief organizations either preparing for or supporting Nepal and Kathmandu and some of the most reputable ones have been compiled by CNN and PRI at http://cnn.it/1GiX17Z and http://bit.ly/1GjrqTm and they all deserve your support, some good alternative options are;

The American Red Cross is working with the Nepal Red Cross for relief support and the link to that is here or Americares at the Americare Donation Page or the Care organization.

story:
Hey guys!

On April 26, we (Louise, Xavier and Thomas) are running Scotia Bank's 21k run in Montreal. This is a great opportunity to raise money for a good cause!

Indigo is an association based in Nice, south of France. It organizes events (magicians, clowns, painting for mom/dad's day of course, cinema workshops... the good life!) and trips for kids who suffer from cancer. Because the association is directly linked to the Centre Universitaire Hospitalier de Nice (public hospital), it also pays for the training of the nurses and carers of the hospital.

These people are truly amazing, always in a good mood, incredibly dedicated, great confidants and unshakable support to the kids!

If you feel in a generous mood or feel concerned by this cause, we need your help! Please donate! Any amount between $5 or $15 will do. If you are overflowing with philanthropy, don't be afraid to give more! And if you don't want to donate no problem, at least now you know about Indigo!

Thanks for your attention, keep it groovy,

Louise, Xavier and Thomas

PS: For more any questions or concern, send us a message: tcarrelb@hotmail.fr


Donner depuis la France:

Si vous n'arrivez pas à donner avec votre carte de credit, vous pouvez envoyer un chèque à l'adresse suivante:


Association Indigo
Fondation Lenval
57 Ave, de la Californie
06200 NICE

Merci pour Indigo!
